body:
This is related to https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/698.

If I had to take a guess, weechat is probably using the normal mouse reports in Alacritty, but using sgr mouse reports in other terminal emulators. Normal mouse reports do not support anything past column 223 iirc, so that would lead to issues.

Does changing the `TERM` to something like `xterm-256color` resolve this issue? Then maybe there's some code in weechat which sets the mouse mode based on the terminfo string, rather than terminal capabilities.
I forgot to mention that I have tried with both `TERM` set to alacirtty and xterm. Both have the same problem.

Interesting, that means that both should be using the same mouse report mode. It would probably be worth investigating which mouse mode exactly is set by weechat. There's potentially some more issues with the SGR mouse mode? If the normal mouse mode is requested, then this is the intended behavior afaik.

If the escapes `1005`, `1006` or `1015` are sent, that would mean that weechat is actually trying to make use of a mouse mode that supports more than 223 columns. IIRC Alacritty doesn't have full support for `1015` since `1006` should be preferred. Maybe that's related.
I can't reproduce this issue. Is this still present for you @DarkDefender?
I can still reproduce this with 0.3.3. Has anything changed in this regard with master?
@chrisduerr also how many cells is the width of your terminal? You might need to use a very small font to trigger this
I can repro on my 1440p display. However haven't looked into the cause of this at all yet. I wouldn't expect this to be too difficult though.

This issue is caused by a limitation of a normal mouse mode lines/cols to be less then `223`, so clicks after a certain point are just filtered out. See the following line.

https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/93e87eb0f1858138113d4ecdfaa8bfac3c127a39/alacritty/src/input.rs#L372

This behavior is intended according to [xterm manual](https://invisible-island.net/xterm/ctlseqs/ctlseqs.html#h2-Mouse-Tracking). So, I'm not sure what we should do here now (we can wrap, but I don't think that it's a right thing to do). @chrisduerr, What do you think?

I wonder whether adding UTF-8 encoding resolve this issue.
IIRC, other terminals like urxvt and gnome terminal removed this limitation a while back. But I'm not totally sure. At least that would explain why it work with those terminals and not alacritty.
The issue was identified and verified. We should add UTF-8(1005) encoding support https://invisible-island.net/xterm/ctlseqs/ctlseqs.html#h2-Mouse-Tracking to resolve it, since weechat is using it.

rename.from: Weechat mouse presses and motions is not registered after a certain point.

issue.title: UTF-8 mouse mode escape sequence (`CSI ? 1005 h` / `CSI ? 1005 l`)
